Name: Requiring signage as to the location of libraries.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring signage as to the location of libraries
Summary: This bill would require the Department of Transportation to post signs at prominent locations within five blocks of public libraries that indicate the location of those libraries.
Text:
Int. No. 688

By Council Member Van Bramer

..Title
A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring signage as to the location of libraries
..Body

Be it enacted by the Council as follows: 
	Section 1. Subchapter two of chapter one of title 19 of the administrative code of the city 
of New York is amended by adding a new section 19-175.6 to read as follows: 
      �19-175.6 Library Signage. The department shall post signage at prominent locations 
within a five block radius of public libraries that indicates the location of such public libraries.
	� 2. This local law takes effect 90 days after it becomes law.
